lines.text:
[praying to save his dog from the pound]
Dear Lord, that Petey is the only friend I've got. I just gotta have five dollars somehow.
[a five-dollar bill blows out of a woman's hand and, floating about a block down the street, lands a few feet in front of where Stymie is sitting]
Boy, that's what I call service!
Is he a vegetarian?
Unh-uh. He's just like me, he's a Methodist.
Ya ain't got any loose food layin' around that ya ain't usin', has ya, Mrs. Lady?
What do you want to eat?
I wanna double order of ham and eggs, and I want a piece of pie, and I want a cup a... cup a coffee.
You must be hungry.
Boy, and how, I could eat a rubber boot!
Got any money?
Nope.
Well, then how do you expect to eat?
Well, we don't expect to, we just want to!

[on the verge of crying]
Please don't take my dog, Mister.
Well, where's his license?
He ain't got no license, he's just got fleas.
So YOU'RE the one who let those dogs loose, huh?
Yes, sir, but I'm sorry.
Just for that, if you don't have $5 at the dog pound in a half an hour, I'm gonna KILL that pooch.
